intro: Rhynchospora hispidula var. major, commonly known as the hairy spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. This perennial herb typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small, usually greenish flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it thrive in moist, often nutrient-poor environments.
